channel.title: Please help!
channel.description:
hello there moparscape.... im a bit new to this HUGE community... but i was wondering if someone could help me code my server? im a bit new to this. I'm not asking somone to do it for me or anything, just help me and teach me. Be warned though, i'm not very good. I'd appriciate if you could be patient with me :) my server is a 317 loading 634 cache. I do have skype, my name is: SwagOfDiab. when you add me please send me a meassge that you read this thread. thanks! (if im not supposed to post here please tell me and ill post it in correct area..sorry again this is a first for me :P
(PS im using the battlesoft source)

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

callmedragon:

Sorry but everyone here has self taught themselves nobody is gonna waste time helping you unless they are paid and half the people that doi that are horrible coders and cant fix half the stuff. If you cant already read java… Your screwed most of these people probably took a class in school to learn how like i did

Not everybody lives in a country where you can do that.

OT: Read some books about Java, download some pdfs, that’s how I learned it.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @callmedragon callmedragon
item.description:
@callmedragon wrote:

Nobody will just do everything for you if they see that you are an incapable owner they will leave. Nobody wants an owner than can’t code there own server…

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

callmedragon:

If you cant already read java… Your screwed most of these people probably took a class in school to learn how like i did

Everyone has to learn it sometime. Also, most of the community did not take a class on it, they learned through experience. I learned what I know from programming RSPS and taking small steps into Swing and other areas of the language, but by no means do you need to take a class to learn the language. It will help, sure.

@Thread: You can always make a development thread, but make sure to follow the guidelines. Learn the basics of java, such as datatypes, if-statements, switch-statements, etc. Then as you progress you can move onto more difficult things.

Read full topic
